SENT.plain: Two patients affected with a multiple sclerosis developed cerebral venous thrombosis after lumbar puncture and treatment with intravenous methylprednisolone
In one case, the course was favorable
The second patient died in spite of intracerebral thrombolysis
The autopsy confirmed the diagnosis of cerebral venous thrombosis and multiple sclerosis
We discuss the relationship between lumbar puncture, steroid treatment and cerebral venous thrombosis
